thread.title_full: See the complete list of Inaugural balls

author: USA TODAY
title: See the complete list of Inaugural balls
text:
See the complete list of Inaugural balls There are three official balls this year, plus many more festivities around D.C. Post to Facebook See the complete list of Inaugural balls There are three official balls this year, plus many more festivities around D.C.  //usat.ly/2jAhMLJ   See the complete list of Inaugural balls Cara Kelly , USA TODAY Published 5:48 p.m. ET Jan. 18, 2017 | Updated 23 minutes ago Donald Trump and Mike Pence will appear at the official Inaugural balls. (Photo: Kevin Dietsch, Pool/European Pressphoto Agency)   
President-elect Donald Trump will be attending three official balls Friday night . But there will be several other events and festivities around the nation's capital for inaugural revelers, and those looking for some counter-programming. 
Liberty   
Jan. 20 
Held at the Walter E. Washington Convention Center 
The president-elect, along with vice president-elect will be in attendance. According to a release Tuesday, the Presidential Inaugural Committee will provide television networks the right to air the live two-hour show simultaneously in both balls, though no timing or station information has been provided. 
Special guests include Sam Moore, Tim Rushlow and his Big Band, Silhouettes,   Boheme. 
Salute to Our Armed Services Ball 
Held at the National Building Museum 
Special performances from Tony Orlando and Josh Weathers. 
Jan. 20 
Held at the Harman Center for the Arts 
Hosted by Tim Daly ( Madam Secretary ), John Leguizamo ( Chef) , Christina Hendricks ( Mad Men ), Wendi McLendon-Covey ( The Goldbergs ), Reid Scott ( Veep ), Alia Shawkat ( Arrested Development ), Tim Simons ( Veep ), Alysia Reiner ( Orange Is the New Black ), Matthew Modine ( Stranger Things ), Mae Whitman ( Parenthood ), Cheryl Hines ( Curb Your Enthusiasm ), Dean Norris ( Breaking Bad ), Danielle Panabaker ( The Flash ), Geoffrey Arend ( Madam Secretary ), and others. Special performance by the Blues Traveler. 
Jan. 19 
Museum of African American History and Culture 
Hosted by Busboys and Poets, special guests include Solange, Angela Davis, Alice Walker, Danny Glover, Melissa Harris-Perry, Esperanza Spalding and Van Jones. 
Jan. 20 
Held at the National Portrait Gallery 
Billed as Washington's largest non-political, political event. A chance to step back to Women's Suffrage, the end of the first World War, the Volstead Act (in memoriam), Prohibition, and the roaring sights and sounds of the 1920's.
